data: Capital/upper part of a roughly square base, originally supporting an offering (as indicated by the carved hollow in the upper surface). A substantial cornice projects around the upper part of the base. Below on one flat face (W 36 cm) is a three line inscription. The surface was covered with a white stucco, of which traces remain.
Three lines of Greek, engraved immediately below the cornice on one face, with consistent left margin.
Found in 1874 in the Malophoros sanctuary in Gaggera, Selinunte, in front of the 'propylon'.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 27-09-2021
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo

Italy Sicily Palermo Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas 8785 Ancient Greek

Capital/upper part of a roughly square base, originally supporting an offering (as indicated by the carved hollow in the upper surface). A substantial cornice projects around the upper part of the base. Below on one flat face (W 36 cm) is a three line inscription. The surface was covered with a white stucco, of which traces remain.

tufa limestone base 27 46.5 37.5

Three lines of Greek, engraved immediately below the cornice on one face, with consistent left margin.

chiselled
